required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Verify Clinical Utility of Point-of-Care (POC) Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) Test Kits as Compared to Third Generation TSH Test Kit
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center Interventional Study to Verify Clinical Utility of the Quantitative and the Qualitative POC TSH Test Kits Compared With the Third Generation TSH Test Kit

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 4, single-center, open-label, interventional study, wherein 274 subjects will be enrolled, who will be tested for Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) by using the quantitative and the qualitative Point-of-Care (POC) TSH test kits and the third generation TSH test kit at the same time.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative (Positive and Negative) Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) levels
Absolute concentration of Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH)

intervention.description: A drop of blood will be taken from subject's fingertip to test TSH quantitatively by using the quantitative POC TSH test kit according to the product specification on Visit 1 (that is, Day 1 to Day 5 after enrolment).

A drop of blood will be taken from subject's fingertip to test TSH qualitatively by using the qualitative POC TSH test kit according to the product specification on Visit 1 (that is, Day 1 to Day 5 after enrolment).
Subject's venous blood will be taken to test TSH levels, by using the third generation TSH test kit in the central laboratory of the hospital on Visit 1 (that is, Day 1 to Day 5 after enrolment).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Suspected hypothyroidism subject
- Signed informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- Legal incapacity or limited legal capacity
- Unwilling or unable to complete the study or not ready to sign the informed consent
